summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Since many people have attempted to write an orderly account of the events that have transpired among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as they were passed down to us by those who had been eyewitnesses and servants of the word from the beginning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, too, have carefully investigated everything from the beginning and have decided to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may know the certainty of the things you have been taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the reign of King Herod of Judea, there was a priest named Zechariah, who belonged to the priestly order of Abijah. His wife was a descendant of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both of them were righteous before God, having lived blamelessly according to all of the commandments and regulations of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had no children because Elizabeth was barren and because both of them were getting old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zechariah was serving with his division of priests in God’s presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he was chosen by lot to go into the sanctuary of the Lord and burn incense, according to the custom of the priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the entire congregation of people was praying outside at the time when the incense was burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing at the right side of the incense altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zechariah saw him, he was startled, and fear overwhelmed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel told him, “Stop being afraid, Zechariah, because your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you are to name him John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have great joy, and many people will rejoice at his birth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he will be great in the Lord’s presence. He will never drink wine or any strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit even before he is born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will bring many of Israel’s descendants back to the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the one who will go before the Lord with the spirit and power of Elijah to turn the hearts of parents to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous, and to prepare the people to be ready for the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zechariah asked the angel, “How can I be sure of this, since I am an old man, and my wife is getting older?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel! I stand in the very presence of God. I have been sent to speak to you and to announce this good news to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because you did not believe my announcement, which will be fulfilled at its proper time, you will become silent and unable to speak until the day this happens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the people kept waiting for Zechariah and wondering why he stayed in the sanctuary so long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he did come out, he was unable to speak to them. Then they realized that he had seen a vision in the sanctuary. He kept motioning to them but remained unable to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of his service were over, he went home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, his wife Elizabeth became pregnant and remained in seclusion for five months. She said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord did for me when he looked favorably on me and took away my public disgrace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the sixth month of her pregnancy, the angel Gabriel was sent by God to a city in Galilee called Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin engaged to a man named Joseph, a descendant of David. The virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel came to her and said, “Greetings, you who are highly favored! The Lord is with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Startled by his statement, she tried to figure out what his greeting meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel told her, “Stop being afraid, Mary, because you have found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Listen! You will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and you are to name him Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High, and the Lord God will give him the throne of his ancestor David.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He will rule over the house of Jacob forever, and his kingdom will never end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary asked the angel, “How can this happen, since I have not had relations with a man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come over you, and the power of the Most High will surround you. Therefore, the child will be holy and will be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And listen! Elizabeth, your relative, has herself conceived a son in her old age, this woman who was rumored to be barren is in her sixth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing is impossible with respect to any of God’s promises.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary said, “Truly I am the Lord’s servant. Let everything you have said happen to me.” Then the angel left her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, Mary set out for a Judean city in the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went into Zechariah’s home and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby jumped in her womb. Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she loudly exclaimed, “How blessed are you among women, and how blessed is the infant in your womb!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should this happen to me, to have the mother of my Lord visit me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb jumped for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blessed is this woman who believed that what the Lord told her would be fulfilled!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Mary said,
“My soul praises the greatness of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My spirit exults in God, my Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he has looked favorably on his humble servant. 
From now on, all generations will call me blessed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the Almighty has done great things for me.
        His name is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His mercy lasts from generation to generation
    for those who fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He displayed his mighty power with his arm.
    He scattered people who were proud in mind and heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He pulled powerful rulers from their thrones
    and lifted up humble people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He filled hungry people with good things
    and sent rich people away with nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He helped his servant Israel,
    remembering to be merciful,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
according to the promise he made to our ancestors—
    to Abraham and his descendants forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months and then went back home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came for Elizabeth to have her child, she gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown his great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day they went to circumcise the child. They were going to name him Zechariah after his father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but his mother said, “Absolutely not! He must be named John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their friends told her, “None of your relatives has that name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they motioned to the baby’s father to see what he wanted to name him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And everyone was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, Zechariah could open his mouth, his tongue was set free, and he began to speak and to praise God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear came over all their neighbors, and throughout the hill country of Judea all these things were being discussed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who heard about it kept thinking what had happened and asked, “What will this child become?” because it was obvious that the hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed be the Lord God of Israel!
    He has taken care of his people and has set them free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has raised up a mighty Savior for us
    from the family of his servant David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
just as he promised long ago
through the mouth of his holy prophets
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that he would save us from our enemies
    and from the grip of all who hate us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has shown mercy to our ancestors
    and remembered his holy covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the oath that he swore to our ancestor Abraham. 
He granted us
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
deliverance from our enemies’ grip
    so that we could serve him without fear
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be holy and righteous before him all of our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High,
    because you will go ahead of the Lord to prepare his way
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and to give his people knowledge of salvation
    through forgiveness of their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the tender mercy of our God,
    his light from on high has visited us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to shine on those who sit in darkness and in death’s shadow,
    and to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the child continued to grow and to become spiritually strong. He lived in the wilderness until the day he appeared in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in those days an order was published by Caesar Augustus that the whole world should be registered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the first registration taken while Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people went to their hometowns to be registered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph, too, went up from the city of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to the City of David (called Bethlehem), because he was a descendant of the household and family of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went there to be registered with Mary, who had been promised to him in marriage and was pregnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were there, the time came for her to have her baby,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she gave birth to her first child, a son. She wrapped him in strips of cloth and laid him in a feeding trough, because there was no place for them in the guest quarters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that region there were shepherds living in the fields, watching their flock during the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel told them, “Stop being afraid! Listen! I am bringing you good news of great joy for all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today your Savior, the Lord Messiah, was born in the City of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this will be a sign for you: You will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth and lying in a feeding trough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a multitude of the Heavenly Army appeared with the angel, praising God by saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Glory to God in the highest, and peace on earth to people who enjoy his favor!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angels had left them and gone back to heaven, the shepherds told one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem and see what has taken place that the Lord has told us about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went quickly and found Mary and Joseph with the baby, who was lying in the feeding trough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw this, they repeated what they had been told about this child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Mary continued to treasure all these things in her heart and to ponder them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the shepherds returned to their flock, glorifying and praising God for everything they had heard and seen, just as it had been told to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After eight days had passed, the infant was circumcised and named Jesus, the name given him by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came for their purification according to the Law of Moses, Joseph and Mary took Jesus up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as it is written in the Law of the Lord, “Every firstborn son is to be designated as holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also offered a sacrifice according to what is specified in the Law of the Lord: “a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man named Simeon was in Jerusalem. This man was righteous and devout. He was waiting for the one who would comfort Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die until he had seen the Lord’s Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Led by the Spirit, he went into the Temple. When the parents brought the child Jesus to do for him what was customary under the Law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon took the infant in his arms and praised God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Master, now you are dismissing your servant in peace
    according to your promise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because my eyes have seen your salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which you prepared for all people to see—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a light that will reveal salvation to unbelievers
    and bring glory to your people Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus’ father and mother kept wondering at the things being said about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simeon blessed them and told Mary, his mother, “This infant is destined to cause many in Israel to fall and rise. Also, he will be a sign that will be opposed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, a sword will pierce your own soul, too, so that the inner thoughts of many people might be revealed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Anna, a prophetess, was also there. She was a descendant of Phanuel from the tribe of Asher. She was very old, having lived with her husband for seven years after her marriage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then as a widow for 84 years. She never left the Temple, but continued to worship there night and day with times of fasting and prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then she came forward and began to thank God and to speak about Jesus to everyone who was waiting for the redemption of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After doing everything required by the Law of the Lord, Joseph and Mary returned to their hometown of Nazareth in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the child continued to grow and to become strong. He was filled with wisdom, and God’s favor rested upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every year Jesus’ parents would go to Jerusalem for the Passover Festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus was twelve years old, they went up to the festival as usual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of the festival were over, they left for home. The young man Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but his parents did not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They thought that he was in their group of travelers. After traveling for a day, they started looking for him among their relatives and friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem, searching desperately for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three days later, they found him in the Temple sitting among the teachers, listening to them, and posing questions to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard him were amazed at his intelligence and his answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus’ parents saw him, they were shocked. His mother asked him, “Son, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I have been worried sick looking for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I had to be in my Father’s house?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they did not understand what he told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went back with them, returning to Nazareth and remaining in submission to them. His mother continued to treasure all these things in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Jesus kept on growing wiser and more mature, and in favor with God and his fellow man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Caesar Tiberius, when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Annas and Caiaphas high priests, a message from God came to John, the son of Zechariah, in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John went throughout the entire Jordan region, proclaiming a baptism about repentance for the forgiveness of sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as it is written in the book of the words of the prophet Isaiah,
“He is a voice calling out in the wilderness:
    ‘Prepare the way for the Lord! Make his paths straight!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every valley will be filled,
    and every mountain and hill will be leveled.
The crooked ways will be made straight,
    and the rough roads will be made smooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone will see the salvation
    that God has provided.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John would say to the crowds that were coming out to be baptized by him, “You children of serpents! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Produce fruit that is consistent with repentance! Don’t begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have father Abraham!’ because I tell you that God can raise up descendants for Abraham from these stones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ax already lies against the roots of the trees. So every tree not producing good fruit will be cut down and thrown into a fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowds kept asking him, “What, then, should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “The person who has two coats must share with the one who doesn’t have any, and the person who has food must do the same.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even some tax collectors came to be baptized. They asked him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Stop collecting more money than the amount you are told to collect.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even some soldiers were asking him, “And what should we do?”
He told them, “Never extort money from anyone by threats or blackmail, and be satisfied with your pay.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people were filled with expectation, and all of them were wondering if John was perhaps the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John replied to all of them, “I’m baptizing you with water, but one is coming who is more powerful than I, and I’m not worthy to untie his sandal straps. It is he who will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing fork is in his hand to clean up his threshing floor. He’ll gather the grain into his barn, but he’ll burn the chaff with inextinguishable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many other exhortations John continued to proclaim the good news to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch had been rebuked by John because he had married his brother’s wife Herodias and because of all of the other evil things Herod had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Added to all this, Herod locked John up in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people had been baptized, Jesus, too, was baptized. While he was praying, heaven opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended on him, appearing in the form of a dove. Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “You are my Son, whom I love. I am pleased with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus himself was about 30 years old when he began his ministry. He was (as legally calculated) the son of Joseph, the son of Heli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Admin, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan. He was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where he was being tempted by the Devil for 40 days. During that time he ate nothing at all, and when they were over he became hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Devil told him, “Since you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become a loaf of bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus answered him, “It is written,
‘One must not live on bread alone,
    but on every word of God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Devil also took him to a high place and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in an instant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told Jesus, “I will give you all this authority, along with their glory, because it has been given to me, and I give it to anyone I please.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you will worship me, all this will be yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus answered him, “It is written,
 ‘You must worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Devil also took him into Jerusalem and had him stand on the highest point of the Temple. He told Jesus, “Since you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because it is written,
‘God will put his angels in charge of you
    to watch over you carefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With their hands they will hold you up,
    so that you will never hit your foot against a rock.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It has been said, ‘You must not tempt the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After the Devil had finished tempting Jesus in every possible way, he left him until another time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus returned to Galilee by the power of the Spirit. Meanwhile, the news about him spread throughout the surrounding country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to teach in their synagogues and was continuously receiving praise from everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came to Nazareth, where he had been raised. As was his custom, he went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day. When he stood up to read,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. Unrolling the scroll, he found the place where it was written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is upon me;
    he has anointed me to tell
        the good news to the poor.
He has sent me to announce release to the prisoners
    and recovery of sight to the blind,
        to set oppressed people free,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and to announce the year of the Lord’s favor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. While the eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fixed on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he began to say to them, “Today this Scripture has been fulfilled, as you’ve heard it read aloud.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All the people began to speak well of him and to wonder at the gracious words that flowed from his mouth. They said, “This is Joseph’s son, isn’t it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them, “You will probably quote this proverb to me, ‘Doctor, heal yourself! Do everything here in your hometown that we hear you did in Capernaum.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He added, “I tell all of you with certainty, a prophet is not accepted in his hometown.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I’m telling you the truth—there were many widows in Israel in Elijah’s time, when it didn’t rain for three years and six months and there was a severe famine everywhere in the land.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yet Elijah wasn’t sent to a single one of those widows except to one at Zarephath in Sidon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: There were also many lepers in Israel in the prophet Elisha’s time, yet not one of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All the people in the synagogue became furious when they heard this.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They got up, forced Jesus out of the city, and led him to the edge of the hill on which their city was built, intending to throw him off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he walked right through the middle of them and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went down to Capernaum, a city in Galilee, and began teaching the people on Sabbath days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were utterly amazed at what he taught, because his message was spoken with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the synagogue was a man who had a demon. He screamed with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Oh, no! What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But Jesus rebuked him. “Be quiet,” he said, “and come out of him!” At this, the demon threw the man down in the middle of the synagogue and came out of him without hurting him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Overwhelmed with amazement, they all kept saying to one another, “What kind of statement is this?—because with authority and power he gives orders to unclean spirits, and they come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So news about him spread to every place in the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus got up to leave the synagogue and went into Simon’s house. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was sick with a high fever, so they asked Jesus about her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bent over her, rebuked the fever, and it left her. She got up at once and began serving them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun was setting, everyone who had any friends suffering from various diseases brought them to him. He placed his hands on each of them and began healing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even demons came out of many people, screaming, “You are the Son of God!” But Jesus rebuked them and ordered them not to speak, because they knew he was the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At daybreak he left and went to a deserted place, while the crowds kept looking for him. When they came to him, they tried to keep him from leaving them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told them, “I have to proclaim the good news about the kingdom of God in other cities, because I was sent to do that also.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So he continued to preach in the synagogues of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, as the crowd was pressing in on him to listen to God’s word, Jesus was standing by the lake of Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw two boats lying on the shore, but the fishermen had stepped out of them and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus got into one of the boats (the one that belonged to Simon) and asked him to push out a little from the shore. Then he sat down and began to teach the crowds from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had finished speaking, he told Simon, “Push out into deep water, and lower your nets for a catch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered, “Master, we have worked hard all night and caught nothing. But if you say so, I’ll lower the nets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the men had done this, they caught so many fish that the nets began to tear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. They came and filled both boats until the boats began to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Simon Peter saw this, he fell down at Jesus’ knees and said, “Leave me, Lord! I am a sinful man!”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Simon and all the people who were with him were amazed at the number of fish they had caught,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and so were James and John, Zebedee’s sons and Simon’s partners.
Then Jesus told Simon, “Stop being afraid. From now on you will be catching people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they brought the boats to shore, they left everything and followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, while Jesus was in one of the cities, a man covered with leprosy saw Jesus and fell on his face, begging him, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus reached out his hand and touched him, saying, “I do want to. Be clean!” Instantly the leprosy left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus ordered him, “Don’t tell anyone. Instead, go and show yourself to the priest and make an offering for your cleansing, just as Moses commanded, as proof to the authorities.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the news about Jesus spread even more, and many crowds began gathering to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, he continued his habit of retiring to deserted places and praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, as Jesus was teaching, some Pharisees and teachers of the Law happened to be sitting nearby. The people had come from every village in Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was present to heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men were bringing a paralyzed man on a stretcher. They were trying to take him into the house and place him in front of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they couldn’t find a way to get him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down on his stretcher through the tiles into the middle of the room, right in front of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said, “Mister, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees began to argue among themselves, saying, “Who is this man who is uttering blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Jesus knew that they were arguing, he asked them, “Why are you arguing about this among yourselves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so you’ll know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins….” he told the paralyzed man, “I say to you: Get up, pick up your stretcher, and go home!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man immediately stood up in front of them and picked up what he had been lying on. Then he went home, praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amazement seized all the people, and they began to praise God. They were filled with fear and declared, “We have seen wonderful things today!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax collector’s desk. He told him, “Follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Levi left everything behind, got up, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, Levi gave a large banquet at his home for Jesus. A large crowd of tax collectors and others were eating with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and their scribes started complaining to Jesus’ disciples, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered them, “Healthy people don’t need a physician, but sick people do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not come to call righteous people, but sinners, to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told him, “John’s disciples frequently fast and pray, and so do those of the Pharisees. But your disciples keep right on eating and drinking.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told them, “You can’t force the wedding guests to fast while the groom is still with them, can you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the time will come when the groom will be taken away from them, and at that time they will fast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them a parable: “No one tears a piece of cloth from a new garment and sews it on an old garment. If he does, the new cloth will tear, and the piece from the new won’t match the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will make the skins burst, the wine will be spilled, and the skins will be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, new wine is to be poured into fresh wineskins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one who has been drinking old wine wants new wine, because he says, ‘The old wine is good enough!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One time Jesus was walking through some grain fields on a Sabbath. His disciples were picking the heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands, and eating them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees asked, “Why are you doing what isn’t lawful on Sabbath days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his companions became hungry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How was it that he went into the house of God, took the Bread of the Presence and ate it, which was not lawful for anyone but the priests to eat, and then gave some of it to his companions?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once, on another Sabbath, Jesus went into a synagogue and began teaching. A man whose right hand was paralyzed was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees were watching Jesus closely to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, in order to find a way of accusing him of doing something wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus knew what they were thinking. So he told the man with the paralyzed hand, “Get up, and stand in the middle of the synagogue.” So he got up and stood there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked them, “I ask you, is it lawful to do good or to do evil on the Sabbath, to save a life or to destroy it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked around at all of them and then told the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man did so, and his hand was restored to health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The others were furious and began to discuss with each other what they could do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was in those days that Jesus went to a mountain to pray, and he spent the whole night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When daylight came, he called his disciples and chose twelve of them, whom he also called apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon (whom he named Peter), his brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matthew, Thomas, James (the son of Alphaeus), Simon (who was called the Zealot),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas (the son of James), and Judas Iscariot (who became a traitor).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came down with them and stood on a level place, along with many of his disciples and a large gathering of people from all over Judea, Jerusalem, and the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had come to hear him and to be healed of their diseases. Even those who were being tormented by unclean spirits were being healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The entire crowd was trying to touch him, because power was coming out from him and healing all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus looked at his disciples and said,
“How blessed are you who are destitute,
    because the kingdom of God is yours!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed are you who are hungry now,
    because you will be satisfied!
How blessed are you who are crying now,
    because you will laugh!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How blessed are you whenever people hate you, avoid you, insult you, and slander you because of the Son of Man!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice in that day and leap for joy, because your reward in heaven is great! That’s the way their ancestors used to treat the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But how terrible it will be for you who are rich,
    because you have had your comfort!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How terrible it will be for you who are full now,
    because you will be hungry!
How terrible it will be for you who are laughing now,
    because you will mourn and cry!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How terrible it will be for you when everyone says nice things about you, because that’s the way their ancestors used to treat the false prophets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I say to you who are listening: Love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bless those who curse you, and pray for those who insult you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone strikes you on the cheek, offer him the other one as well, and if someone takes your coat, don’t keep back your shirt, either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep on giving to everyone who asks you for something, and if anyone takes what is yours, do not insist on getting it back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever you want people to do for you, do the same for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love those who love you, what thanks do you deserve? Why, even sinners love those who love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what thanks do you deserve? Even sinners do that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you lend to those from whom you expect to get something back, what thanks do you deserve? Even sinners lend to sinners to get back what they lend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, love your enemies, do good to them, and lend to them, expecting nothing in return. Then your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High, because he is kind even to ungrateful and evil people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stop judging, and you’ll never be judged. Stop condemning, and you’ll never be condemned. Forgive, and you’ll be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give, and it will be given to you. A large quantity, pressed together, shaken down, and running over will be put into your lap, because you’ll be evaluated by the same standard with which you evaluate others.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also told them a parable: “One blind person can’t lead another blind person, can he? Both will fall into a ditch, won’t they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A disciple is not better than his teacher. But everyone who is fully-trained will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you see the speck in your brother’s eye but fail to notice the beam in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me take the speck out of your eye,’ when you don’t see the beam in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you’ll see clearly enough to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A good tree doesn’t produce rotten fruit, and a rotten tree doesn’t produce good fruit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because every tree is known by its own fruit. People don’t gather figs from thorny plants or pick grapes from a thorn bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good person produces good from the good treasure of his heart, and an evil person produces evil from an evil treasure, because the mouth speaks from the overflow of the heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you keep calling me ‘Lord, Lord,’ but don’t do what I tell you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will show you what everyone is like who comes to me, hears my words, and acts on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are like a person building a house, who dug a deep hole to lay the foundation on rock. When a flood came, the floodwaters pushed against that house but couldn’t shake it, because it had been founded on the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person who hears what I say but doesn’t act on it is like someone who built a house on the ground without any foundation. When the floodwaters pushed against it, that house quickly collapsed, and the resulting destruction of that house was extensive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had finished saying all these things to the people who were there listening, he went to Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There a centurion’s servant, whom he valued highly, was sick and about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him to ask him to come and save his servant’s life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went to Jesus and begged him repeatedly, “He deserves to have this done for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he loves our people and built our synagogue for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went with them. He was not far from the house when the centurion sent friends to tell Jesus, “Sir, stop troubling yourself, because I’m not worthy to have you come under my roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why I didn’t presume to come to you. But just say the word, and let my servant be healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I, too, am a man under authority and have soldiers under me. I say to one ‘Go’ and he goes, to another ‘Come’ and he comes, and to my servant ‘Do this’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed at him. Turning to the crowd that was following him, he said, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found this kind of faith!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men who had been sent returned to the house and found the servant in perfect health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterwards, Jesus went to a city called Nain. His disciples and a large crowd were going along with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he approached the entrance to the city, a man who had died was being carried out. He was his mother’s only living son, and she was a widow. A large crowd from the city was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw her, he felt compassion for her. He told her, “You can stop crying.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up and touched the bier, and the men who were carrying it stopped. He said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who had been dead sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him back to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear gripped everyone, and they began to praise God. “A great prophet has appeared among us,” they said, and “God has helped his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This news about Jesus spread throughout Judea and all the surrounding countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s disciples told him about all these things. So John called two of his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent them to the Lord to ask, “Are you the Coming One, or should we wait for someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men had come to Jesus, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to you to ask, ‘Are you the Coming One, or should we wait for someone else?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus had healed many people of diseases, plagues, and evil spirits, and had given sight to many who were blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he answered them, “Go and tell John what you have observed and heard: the blind see, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear again, the dead are raised, and the destitute hear the good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blessed is anyone who is not offended by me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s messengers had gone, Jesus began to ask the crowds about John. “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Really, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fancy clothes? Look! Those who wear fine clothes and live in luxury are in royal palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Really, what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and even more than a prophet!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the man about whom it is written,
‘See, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
    who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, no one has ever been born who is greater than John. Yet even the least important person in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By having been baptized with John’s baptism, all the people who listened, including the tax collectors, acknowledged God’s justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the experts in the Law rejected God’s plan for themselves by refusing to be baptized by John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus continued, “To what may I compare the people living today?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They’re like little children who sit in the marketplace and shout to each other,
‘A wedding song we played for you,
    the dance you all did scorn.
A woeful dirge we chanted, too,
    but then you would not mourn.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because John the Baptist has come neither eating bread nor drinking wine, yet you say, ‘He has a demon!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look! He’s a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is vindicated by all her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one of the Pharisees invited Jesus to eat with him. So he went to the Pharisee’s home and took his place at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a woman who was a notorious sinner in that city. When she learned that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee’s home, she took an alabaster jar of perfume
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and knelt at his feet behind him. She was crying and began to wash his feet with her tears and dry them with her hair. Then she kissed his feet over and over again, anointing them constantly with the perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Pharisee who had invited Jesus saw this and told himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would have known who is touching him and what kind of woman she is. She’s a sinner!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus told him, “Simon, I have something to ask you.”
“Teacher,” he replied, “ask it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men were in debt to a moneylender. One owed him 500 denarii, and the other 50.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they couldn’t pay it back, he generously canceled the debts for both of them. Now which of them will love him more?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon answered, “I suppose the one who had the larger debt canceled.”
Jesus told him, “You have answered correctly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, turning to the woman, he told Simon, “Do you see this woman? I came into your house. You didn’t give me any water for my feet, but this woman has washed my feet with her tears and dried them with her hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t give me a kiss, but this woman, from the moment I came in, has not stopped kissing my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t anoint my head with oil, but this woman has anointed my feet with perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I’m telling you that her sins, as many as they are, have been forgiven, and that’s why she has shown such great love. But the one to whom little is forgiven loves little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told her, “Your sins are forgiven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were at the table with them began to say among themselves, “Who is this man who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus traveled from one city and village to another, preaching and spreading the good news about God’s kingdom. The Twelve were with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as well as some women who had been healed of evil spirits and illnesses: Mary, also called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joanna, the wife of Herod’s household manager Chuza; Susanna; and many others. These women continued to support them out of their personal resources.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from every city, he said in a parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A farmer went out to sow his seed. As he was sowing, some seeds fell along the path, were trampled on, and birds from the sky ate them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell on stony ground, and as soon as they came up, they dried up because they had no moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell among thorn bushes, and the thorn bushes grew with them and choked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others fell on good soil, and when they came up, they produced 100 times as much as was planted.” As he said this, he called out, “Let the person who has ears to hear, listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples began to ask him what this parable meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he said, “You have been given knowledge about the secrets of the kingdom of God. But to others they are given in parables, so that
‘they might look but not see,
    and they might listen but not understand.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is what the parable means. The seed is God’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones on the path are the people who listen, but then the Devil comes and takes the word away from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones on the stony ground are the people who joyfully welcome the word when they hear it. But since they don’t have any roots, they believe for a while, but in a time of testing they fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones that fell among the thorn bushes are the people who listen, but as they go on their way they are choked by the worries, wealth, and pleasures of life, and their fruit doesn’t mature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the ones on the good soil are the people who hear the word but also hold on to it with good and honest hearts, producing a crop through endurance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one lights a lamp and hides it under a bowl or puts it under a bed. Instead, he puts it on a lamp stand so that those who come in will see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing hidden that won’t be revealed, and there is nothing secret that won’t become known and come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So pay attention to how you listen, because to the one who has something, more will be given. However, from the one who doesn’t have, even what he thinks he has will be taken away from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mother and his brothers came to him, but they couldn’t get near him because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was told, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside and want to see you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered those people, “My mother and my brothers are those who hear a message from God and heed it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, Jesus and his disciples got into a boat. He told them, “Let’s cross to the other side of the lake.” So they started out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they were sailing, Jesus fell asleep. A violent storm swept over the lake, and they were taking on water and were in great danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his disciples went to him, woke him up, and kept telling him, “Master! Master! We’re going to die!” He got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waves. They stopped, and there was calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he asked the disciples, “Where’s your faith?”
Frightened and amazed, they asked one another, “Who is this man? He commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They landed in the region of the Gerasenes, which is just across the lake from Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus stepped out on the shore, a man from the city met him. This man was controlled by demons and had not worn clothes for a long time. He did not live in a house but in the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he screamed, fell down in front of him, and cried out in a loud voice, “What do you want from me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you not to torture me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Jesus was in the process of ordering the unclean spirit to come out of the man. On many occasions the unclean spirit had seized the man, and though he was kept under guard and bound with chains and shackles, he would break the chains and be driven by the demon into deserted places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked the man, “What’s your name?”
He answered, “Legion,” because many demons had gone into him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the demons began begging Jesus not to order them to go into the bottomless pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a large herd of pigs was grazing there on the hillside. So the demons begged Jesus to let them go into those pigs, and he consented to that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the demons came out of the man and went into the pigs, and the herd rushed down a steep slope into the lake and drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when those who had been taking care of the pigs saw what had happened, they ran away and reported it in the city and in the countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people went out to see what had happened. When they came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had gone out sitting at Jesus’ feet, dressed and in his right mind, they were frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people who had seen it told them how the demon-possessed man had been healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people from the region surrounding the Gerasenes asked Jesus to leave them, because they were terrified. So he got into a boat and started back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the man from whom the demons had gone out kept begging Jesus to let him go with him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go home and tell what God has done for you.” So the man left and kept proclaiming throughout the whole city how much Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came back, the crowd welcomed him, because everyone was expecting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then a synagogue leader by the name of Jairus arrived. He fell at Jesus’ feet and kept begging him to come to his home,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because his only living daughter, who was about twelve years old, was dying. While Jesus was on his way, the crowds continued to press in on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman was there who had been suffering from chronic bleeding for twelve years. Although she had spent all she had on doctors, no one could heal her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came up behind Jesus and touched the tassel of his garment, and her bleeding stopped at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked, “Who touched me?”
While everyone was denying it, Peter and those who were with him said, “Master, the crowds are surrounding you and pressing in on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still Jesus said, “Somebody touched me, because I know that power has gone out of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw that she couldn’t hide, she came forward trembling. Bowing down in front of him, she explained in the presence of all the people why she had touched Jesus and how she had been instantly healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, someone came from the synagogue leader’s home and told him, “Your daughter is dead. Stop bothering the teacher anymore.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard this, he told the synagogue leader, “Stop being afraid! Just believe, and she will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived at the man’s house, he allowed no one to go in with him except Peter, John, James, and the young girl’s father and mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now everyone was crying and wailing for her. But Jesus said, “Stop crying! She’s not dead. She’s sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laughed and laughed at him, because they knew she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he took her hand and called out, “Young lady, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So her spirit returned, and she got up at once. Then Jesus directed that she be given something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her parents were amazed, but he ordered them not to tell anyone what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called the Twelve together and gave them power and authority over all the demons and to heal diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent them to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Don’t take anything along on your trip—no walking stick, traveling bag, bread, money, or even an extra shirt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you visit a home and stay there, and go out from there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if people don’t welcome you, when you leave that city, shake its dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they left and went from village to village, spreading the good news and healing diseases everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about everything that was happening. He was puzzled because it was said by some that John had been raised from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by others that Elijah had appeared, and by still others that one of the ancient prophets had come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod said, “I beheaded John. But who is this man I’m hearing so much about?” So Herod kept trying to see Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles came back and told Jesus everything they had done. Then he took them away with him privately to a city called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the crowds found out about this and followed him. He welcomed them and began to speak to them about the kingdom of God and to heal those who needed healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the day was drawing to a close, the Twelve came to him and said, “Send the crowd away to the neighboring villages and farms so they can rest and get some food, because we are here in a deserted place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he told them, “You give them something to eat.”
They replied, “We have nothing more than five loaves of bread and two fish—unless we go and buy food for all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were about 5,000 men. So he told his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about 50.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did this and got all of them seated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and blessed them. Then he broke the loaves in pieces and kept giving them to the disciples to pass on to the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them ate and were filled. When they collected the leftover pieces, there were twelve baskets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, while Jesus was praying privately and the disciples were with him, he asked them, “Who do the crowds say I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “Some say John the Baptist, others Elijah, and still others one of the ancient prophets who has come back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “But who do you say I am?”
“God’s Messiah,” Peter replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave them strict orders, commanding them not to tell this to anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The Son of Man must suffer a great deal and be rejected by the elders, the high priests, and the scribes. Then he must be killed, but on the third day he will be raised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told all of them, “If anyone wants to come with me, he must deny himself, pick up his cross every day, and follow me continuously,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What profit will a person have if he gains the whole world, but destroys himself or is lost?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when he comes in his glory and the glory of the Father and the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you with certainty, some people who are standing here won’t experience death until they see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about eight days after Jesus said this, he took Peter, John, and James with him and went up on a mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes turned dazzling white.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, two men were talking with him. They were Moses and Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had a glorified appearance, and were discussing Jesus’ departure that he would shortly bring about in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and the men with him had been overcome by sleep. When they woke up, they saw Jesus’ glory and the two men standing with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Moses and Elijah were leaving, Peter told Jesus, “Master, it’s good that we’re here! Let’s set up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” (Peter didn’t know what he was saying.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while he was saying this, a cloud appeared and surrounded them, and they became terrified as they were being overshadowed by the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a voice came out of the cloud and said, “This is my Son, whom I have chosen. Keep listening to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the voice had spoken, Jesus was alone. The disciples kept silent and at that time told no one about what they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a large crowd met Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a man in the crowd shouted, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, because he is my only living child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without warning a spirit takes control of him, and he suddenly screams, goes into convulsions, and foams at the mouth. The spirit mauls him and refuses to leave him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I begged your disciples to drive it out, but they couldn’t.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “You unbelieving and perverted generation! How much longer must I be with you and put up with you? Bring your son here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even while the boy was coming, the demon knocked him to the ground and threw him into convulsions. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people continued to be amazed at the greatness of God. Indeed, everyone was astonished at all the things Jesus was doing. So he told his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen carefully to these words. The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into human hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t know what this meant. Indeed, the meaning was hidden from them so that they didn’t understand it; and they were afraid to ask him about this statement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, an argument started among the disciples as to which of them might be the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, knowing their inner thoughts, took a little child and had him stand beside him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “Whoever welcomes this little child in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me, because the one who is least among all of you is the one who is greatest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said, “Master, we saw someone driving out demons in your name. We tried to stop him, because he wasn’t a follower like us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Don’t stop him! Because whoever is not against you is for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days grew closer for Jesus to be taken up to heaven, he was determined to continue his journey to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent messengers on ahead of him. On their way they went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people would not welcome him, because he was determined to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his disciples James and John observed this rejection, they asked, “Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven to destroy them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned and rebuked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they all went on to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were walking along the road, a man told him, “I will follow you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus told him,
“Foxes have holes and birds have nests,
    but the Son of Man has no place to rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He told another man, “Follow me.”
But he said, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told him, “Let the dead bury their own dead. But you go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still another man said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first let me say goodbye to those at home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the Lord appointed 70 other disciples and was about to send them ahead of him in pairs to every town and place that he intended to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he instructed them, “The harvest is vast, but the workers are few. So ask the Lord of the harvest to send workers out into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get going! See, I am sending you out like lambs among wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t carry a wallet, a traveling bag, or sandals, and don’t greet anyone on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whatever house you go into, first say, ‘May there be peace in this house.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a peaceful person lives there, your greeting of peace will remain with him. But if that’s not the case, your greeting will come back to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay with the same family, eating and drinking whatever they provide, because the worker deserves his pay. Don’t move from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whenever you go into a town and the people welcome you, eat whatever they serve you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: heal the sick that are there, and tell them, ‘The kingdom of God is near you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whenever you go into a town and people don’t welcome you, go out into its streets and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘We’re wiping off your town’s dust that clings to our feet in protest against you! But realize this: the kingdom of God is near!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, on the last day it will be easier for Sodom than for that town!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How terrible it will be for you, Chorazin! How terrible it will be for you, Bethsaida! If the miracles that happened in you had taken place in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be easier for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum! You won’t be lifted up to heaven, will you? You’ll go down to Hell!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who listens to you listens to me, and the person who rejects you rejects me. The person who rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The 70 disciples came back and joyously reported, “Lord, even the demons are submitting to us in your name!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “I watched Satan falling from heaven like lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! I have given you the authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to destroy all the enemy’s power, and nothing will ever hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, stop rejoicing because the spirits are submitting to you. Instead, rejoice because your names are written in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment, the Holy Spirit made Jesus extremely joyful, so Jesus said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from wise and intelligent people and have revealed them to infants. Yes, Father, because this is what was pleasing to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been entrusted to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and the person to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then turning to his disciples in private, he told them, “How blessed are the eyes that see what you see!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I tell you, many prophets and kings wanted to see the things you see but didn’t see them, and to hear the things you hear but didn’t hear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then an expert in the Law stood up to test Jesus. He asked, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “What is written in the Law? What do you read there?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “You must love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind. And you must love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “You have answered correctly. ‘Do this, and you will live.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man wanted to justify himself, so he asked Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After careful consideration, Jesus replied, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho when he fell into the hands of bandits. They stripped him, beat him, and went away, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By chance, a priest was traveling along that road. When he saw the man, he went by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Similarly, a descendant of Levi came to that place. When he saw the man, he also went by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as he was traveling along, a Samaritan came across the man. When the Samaritan saw him, he was moved with compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring oil and wine on them. Then he put him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper, saying, ‘Take good care of him. If you spend more than that, I’ll repay you when I come back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Of these three men, who do you think was a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of the bandits?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “The one who showed mercy to him.”
Jesus told him, “Go and do what he did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they were traveling along, Jesus went into a village. A woman named Martha welcomed him into her home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had a sister named Mary, who sat down at the Lord’s feet and kept listening to what he was saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was worrying about all the things she had to do, so she came to him and asked, “Lord, you do care that my sister has left me to do the work all by myself, don’t you? Then tell her to help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
