verses.text: The Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha! You worry and fuss about a lot of things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there’s only one thing you need. Mary has chosen what is better, and it is not to be taken away from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once Jesus was praying in a certain place. After he had finished, one of his disciples told him, “Lord, teach us to pray, as John taught his disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he told them, “Whenever you pray you are to say,
‘Father, may your name be kept holy.
    May your kingdom come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep giving us every day our daily bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and forgive us our sins,
as we forgive everyone who sins against us.
And never bring us into temptation.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, let me borrow three loaves of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A friend of mine on a trip has dropped in on me, and I don’t have anything to serve him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose he answers from inside, ‘Stop bothering me! The door is already locked, and my children are here with us in the bedroom. I can’t get up and give you anything!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, even though that man doesn’t want to get up and give him anything because he is his friend, he will get up and give him whatever he needs because of his persistence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I say to you: Keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep searching, and you will find. Keep knocking, and the door will be opened for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because everyone who keeps asking will receive, and the person who keeps searching will find, and the person who keeps knocking will have the door opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What father among you, if his son asks for bread, would give him a stone, or if he asks for a fish, would give him a snake instead of the fish?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he asks for an egg, would he give him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you who are evil know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who keep asking him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was driving a demon out of a man who was unable to talk. When the demon had gone out, the man began to speak, and the crowds were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “He drives out demons by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others, wanting to test Jesus, kept asking him for a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since he knew what they were thinking, he told them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is devastated, and a divided household collapses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, if Satan is divided against himself, how can his kingdom last? After all, you say that I drive out demons by Beelzebul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I drive out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your own followers drive them out? That is why they will be your judges!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I drive out demons by the power of God, then the kingdom of God has come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own mansion, his property is safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when a stronger man than he attacks and defeats him, the stronger man strips off that man’s armor in which he trusted and then divides his plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The person who isn’t with me is against me, and the person who doesn’t gather with me scatters.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whenever an unclean spirit goes out of a person, it wanders through dry places looking for a place to rest but doesn’t find any. So it says, ‘I will go back to my home that I left.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it gets back home, it finds it swept clean and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings with it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they all go in and settle there. And so the final condition of that person is worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was saying this, a woman in the crowd raised her voice and told him, “How blessed is the womb that gave birth to you and the breasts that nursed you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Instead, how blessed are those who hear God’s word and obey it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as the crowds continued to throng around Jesus, he went on to say, “This people living today are an evil generation. It craves a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because just as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the south will stand up at the judgment and condemn the people living today, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. But look, something greater than Solomon is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment and condemn the people living today, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah. But look, something greater than Jonah is here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one lights a lamp and puts it in a hiding place or under a basket, but on a lamp stand, so that those who enter may see its light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light. But when it’s evil, your body is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, be careful that the light in you isn’t darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if your whole body is full of light, with no part of it in darkness, it will be as full of light as when a lamp gives you light with its rays.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had said this, a Pharisee invited him to have a meal with him. So Jesus went and took his place at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee was surprised to see that he didn’t first wash before the meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord told him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but on the inside you are full of greed and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fools! The one who made the outside made the inside, too, didn’t he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So give what is inside to the poor, and then everything will be clean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How terrible it will be for you Pharisees! You give a tenth of your mint, spices, and every kind of herb, but you neglect justice and the love of God. These are the things you should have practiced, without neglecting the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How terrible it will be for you Pharisees! You love to have the places of honor in the synagogues and to be greeted in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How terrible it will be for you! You are like unmarked graves—people walk on them without realizing it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the experts in the Law told him, “Teacher, when you say these things, you insult us, too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “How terrible it will be for you experts in the Law, too! You load people with burdens that are hard to carry, yet you don’t even lift a finger to ease those burdens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How terrible it will be for you! You build monuments for the prophets, and it was your ancestors who killed them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you are witnesses and approve of the deeds of your ancestors, because they killed those for whom you are building monuments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why the Wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles. They will kill some of them and persecute others,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so those living today will be charged with the blood of all the prophets that was shed since the foundation of the world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who died between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be charged against this generation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How terrible it will be for you experts in the Law! You have taken away the key to knowledge. You didn’t go in yourselves, and you kept out those who were trying to go in.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was leaving, the scribes and the Pharisees began to oppose him fiercely, interrogating him about many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They watched him closely in an effort to trap him in something he might say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the people had gathered by the thousands and were trampling on one another. Jesus began to speak first to his disciples. “Watch out for the yeast—that is, the hypocrisy—of the Pharisees!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing covered up that won’t be exposed and nothing secret that won’t be made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, what you have said in darkness will be heard in the daylight, and what you have whispered in private rooms will be shouted from the housetops.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I tell you, my friends, never be afraid of those who kill the body and after that can’t do anything more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll show you the one you should be afraid of. Be afraid of the one who has the authority to throw you into hell after killing you. Yes, I tell you, be afraid of him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Five sparrows are sold for two pennies, aren’t they? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why, even all the hairs on your head have been counted! Stop being afraid. You are worth more than a bunch of sparrows.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I tell you, the Son of Man will acknowledge before God’s angels everyone who acknowledges me before people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever denies me before people will be denied before God’s angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but the person who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit won’t be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When people bring you before synagogue leaders, rulers, or authorities, don’t worry about how you will defend yourselves or what you will say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because at that time the Holy Spirit will teach you what you are to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then someone in the crowd told him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the family inheritance with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus asked him, “Mister, who appointed me to be a judge or arbitrator over you people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “Be careful to guard yourselves against every kind of greed, because a person’s life doesn’t consist of the amount of possessions he has.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them a parable. He said, “The land of a certain rich man produced good crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he began to think to himself, ‘What should I do, since I have no place to store my crops?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, ‘This is what I’ll do. I’ll tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and I’ll store all my grain and goods in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I’ll say to myself, “You’ve stored up plenty of good things for many years. Take it easy, eat, drink, and enjoy yourself.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God told him, ‘You fool! This very night your life will be demanded back from you. Now who will get the things you’ve accumulated?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s how it is with the person who stores up treasures for himself rather than with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told his disciples, “That’s why I’m telling you to stop worrying about your life—what you will eat—or about your body—what you will wear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because life is more than food, and the body more than clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the crows. They don’t plant or harvest, they don’t even have a storeroom or barn, yet God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can any of you add an hour to the length of your life by worrying?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you can’t do a small thing like that, why worry about other things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider how the lilies grow. They don’t work or spin yarn, but I tell you that not even Solomon in all his splendor was clothed like one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if that’s the way God clothes the grass in the field, which is alive today and thrown into an oven tomorrow, how much more will he clothe you—you who have little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So stop concerning yourselves about what you will eat or what you will drink, and stop being distressed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it is the unbelievers who are concerned about all these things. Surely your Father knows that you need them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, be concerned about his kingdom, and these things will be provided for you as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stop being afraid, little flock, because your Father is pleased to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sell your possessions, and give the money to the poor. Make yourselves wallets that don’t wear out—a dependable treasure in heaven, where no thief can get close and no moth can destroy anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must keep your belts fastened and your lamps burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be like people who are waiting for their master to return from a wedding. As soon as he arrives and knocks, they will open the door for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blessed are those servants whom the master finds watching for him when he comes! I tell all of you with certainty, he himself will put on an apron, make them sit down at the table, and go around and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blessed they will be if their master comes in the middle of the night or near dawn and finds them awake!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be sure of this: if the homeowner had known at what time the thief were coming, he would have watched and would not have let his house be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be ready, because the Son of Man is coming at a time when you don’t expect him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter asked, “Lord, are you telling this parable just for us or for everyone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Who, then, is the faithful and careful servant manager whom his master will put in charge of giving all his other servants their share of food at the right time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blessed is that servant whom his master finds doing this when he comes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you with certainty, he will put him in charge of all his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that servant says to himself, ‘My master is taking a long time to come back,’ and begins to beat the other servants and to eat, drink, and get drunk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the master of that servant will come on a day when he doesn’t expect him and at an hour that he doesn’t know. Then his master will punish him severely and assign him a place with unfaithful people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That servant who knew what his master wanted but didn’t prepare himself or do what was wanted will receive a severe beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the servant who did things that deserved a beating without knowing it will receive a light beating. Much will be required from everyone to whom much has been given. But even more will be demanded from the one to whom much has been entrusted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ve come to set the earth on fire, and how I wish it were already ablaze!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have a baptism to be baptized with, and what stress I am under until it’s completed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you think that I came to bring peace on earth? Not at all, I tell you, but rather division!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on, five people in one household will be divided, three against two and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be divided father against son, son against father, mother against daughter, daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told the crowds, “When you see a cloud coming in from the west, you immediately say, ‘There’s going to be a storm,’ and that’s what happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you see a south wind blowing, you say, ‘It’s going to be hot,’ and so it is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, yet you don’t know how to interpret the present time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For example, when you go with your opponent in front of a ruler, do your best to settle with him on the way there. Otherwise, you will be dragged in front of the judge, and the judge will hand you over to an officer, and the officer will throw you into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you will never get out of there until you pay back the last penny!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, some people who were there told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Do you think that these Galileans were more sinful than all the other Galileans because they suffered like this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Absolutely not, I tell you! But if you don’t repent, then you, too, will all die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What about those eighteen people who were killed when the tower at Siloam fell on them? Do you think they were worse offenders than all the other people living in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Absolutely not, I tell you! But if you don’t repent, then you, too, will all die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them this parable: “A man had a fig tree that had been planted in his vineyard. He went to look for fruit on it but didn’t find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told the gardener, ‘Look here! For three years I’ve been coming to look for fruit on this tree but I haven’t found any. Cut it down! Why should it waste the soil?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the gardener replied, ‘Sir, leave it alone for one more year, until I dig around it and fertilize it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maybe next year it will bear fruit. If not, then cut it down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman was there who had a spirit that had disabled her for eighteen years. She was hunched over and completely unable to stand up straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her, he called to her and said, “Woman, you are free from your illness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he placed his hands on her, and immediately she stood up straight and began praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the synagogue leader, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, told the crowd, “There are six days when work is to be done. So come on those days to be healed, and not on the Sabbath day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord replied to him, “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or donkey and lead it out of its stall to give it some water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shouldn’t this woman, a descendant of Abraham whom Satan has kept bound for eighteen long years, be set free from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as he was saying this, all of his opponents were blushing with shame. But the rest of the crowd was rejoicing at all the wonderful things he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went on to say, “What is the kingdom of God like? What can I compare it to?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed that someone took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds of the sky nested in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he said, “To what can I compare the kingdom of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s like yeast that a woman took and mixed with three measures of flour until all of it was leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus taught in one town and village after another as he made his way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Someone asked him, “Lord, are only a few people going to be saved?”
He told them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Keep on struggling to enter through the narrow door, because I tell you that many people will try to enter, but won’t be able to do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the homeowner gets up and closes the door, you can stand outside, knock on the door, and say again and again, ‘Lord, open the door for us!’ But he will answer you, ‘I don’t know where you come from.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he will tell you, ‘I don’t know where you come from. Get away from me, all you who practice evil!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that place there will be crying and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, and you yourselves being driven away on the outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will come from east and west, and from north and south, and will eat in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You see, some who are last will be first, and some who are first will be last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that hour some Pharisees came and told Jesus, “Leave and get away from here, because Herod wants to kill you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Listen! I am driving out demons and healing today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will finish my work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I must be on my way today, tomorrow, and the next day, because it’s not possible for a prophet to be killed outside of Jerusalem.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones to death those who have been sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you people were unwilling!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! Your house is left vacant to you. I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, ‘How blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One Sabbath, Jesus went to the house of a leader of the Pharisees to eat a meal. The guests were watching Jesus closely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man whose body was swollen with fluid suddenly appeared in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus asked the Pharisees and experts in the Law, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept silent. So he took hold of the man, healed him, and sent him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them, “If your son or ox falls into a well on the Sabbath day, you would pull him out immediately, wouldn’t you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they couldn’t argue with him about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus noticed how the guests were choosing the places of honor, he told them a parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding banquet, don’t sit down at the place of honor in case someone more important than you was invited by the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the host who invited both of you would come to you and say, ‘Give this person your place.’ In disgrace, you would have to take the place of least honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are invited, go and sit down at the place of least honor. Then, when your host comes, he will tell you, ‘Friend, move up higher,’ and you will be honored in the presence of everyone who eats with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the person who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told the man who had invited him, “When you give a luncheon or a dinner, stop inviting only your friends, brothers, relatives, or rich neighbors. Otherwise, they may invite you in return and you would be repaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, when you give a banquet, make it your habit to invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will be blessed because they can’t repay you. And you will be repaid when the righteous are resurrected.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one of those eating with him heard this and told him, “How blessed is the person who will eat in the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “A man gave a large banquet and invited many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was time for the banquet, he sent his servant to tell those who were invited, ‘Come! Everything is now ready.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every single one of them began asking to be excused. The first told him, ‘I bought a field, and I need to go out and inspect it. Please excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another said, ‘I bought five pairs of oxen, and I’m on my way to try them out. Please excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still another said, ‘I recently got married, so I can’t come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So the servant went back and reported all this to his master. Then the master of the house became angry and told his servant, ‘Go quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring back the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant said, ‘Sir, what you ordered has been done, and there is still room.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the master told the servant, ‘Go out into the streets and the lanes and make the people come in, so that my house may be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I tell all of you, none of those men who were invited will taste anything at my banquet.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now large crowds were traveling with Jesus. He turned and told them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters, as well as his own life, he can’t be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever doesn’t carry his cross and follow me can’t be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. He will first sit down and estimate the cost to see whether he has enough money to finish it, won’t he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, if he lays a foundation and can’t finish the building, everyone who watches will begin to ridicule him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘This person started a building but couldn’t finish it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or suppose a king is going to war against another king. He will first sit down and consider whether with 10,000 men he can fight the one coming against him with 20,000 men, won’t he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he can’t, he will send a delegation to ask for terms of peace while the other king is still far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, none of you can be my disciple unless he gives up all his possessions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, salt is good. But if the salt should lose its taste, how can its flavor be restored?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s suitable neither for the soil nor for the manure pile. People throw it away. Let the person who has ears to hear, listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the tax collectors and sinners kept coming to listen to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the scribes kept complaining, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them this parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose one of you has 100 sheep and loses one of them. He leaves the 99 in the wilderness and looks for the one that is lost until he finds it, doesn’t he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he finds it, he puts it on his shoulders and rejoices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he goes home, calls his friends and neighbors together, and says to them, ‘Rejoice with me, because I’ve found my lost sheep!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, I tell you that there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over 99 righteous people who don’t need to repent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or suppose a woman has ten coins and loses one of them. She lights a lamp, sweeps the house, and searches carefully until she finds it, doesn’t she?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found the coin that I lost!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, I tell you that there is joy in the presence of God’s angels over one sinner who repents.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “A man had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger one told his father, ‘Father, give me my share of the estate.’ So the father divided his property between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A few days later, the younger son gathered everything he owned and traveled to a distant country. There he wasted it all on wild living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had spent everything, a severe famine took place throughout that country, and he began to be in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went out to work for one of the citizens of that country, who sent him into his fields to feed pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one would give him anything, even though he would gladly have filled himself with the husks the pigs were eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he came to his senses and said, ‘How many of my father’s hired men have more food than they can eat, and here I am starving to death!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will get up, go to my father, and say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I don’t deserve to be called your son anymore. Treat me like one of your hired men.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he got up and went to his father. While he was still far away, his father saw him and was filled with compassion. He ran to his son, threw his arms around him, and kissed him affectionately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his son told him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and you. I don’t deserve to be called your son anymore.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the father told his servants, ‘Hurry! Bring out the best robe and put it on him, and put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring the fattened calf and kill it, and let’s eat and celebrate!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because my son was dead and has come back to life. He was lost and has been found.’ And they began to celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the father’s older son was in the field. As he was coming back to the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called to one of the servants and asked what was happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant told him, ‘Your brother has come home, and your father has killed the fattened calf because he got him back safely.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the older son became angry and wouldn’t go into the house. So his father came out and began to plead with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered his father, ‘Listen! All these years I’ve worked like a slave for you. I’ve never disobeyed a command of yours. Yet you’ve never given me so much as a young goat for a festival so I could celebrate with my friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this son of yours spent your money on prostitutes, and when he came back, you killed the fattened calf for him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His father told him, ‘My child, you are always with me, and everything I have is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we had to celebrate and rejoice, because this brother of yours was dead and has come back to life. He was lost and has been found.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus was saying to the disciples, “A rich man had a servant manager who was accused of wasting his assets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called for him and asked him, ‘What’s this I hear about you? You can’t be my manager any longer. Now give me a report about your management!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the servant manager told himself, ‘What should I do? My master is taking my position away from me. I’m not strong enough to plow, and I’m ashamed to beg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what I’ll do so that people will welcome me into their homes when I’m dismissed from my job.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he called for each of his master’s debtors. He asked the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied, ‘A hundred jars of olive oil.’ The manager told him, ‘Get your bill. Sit down quickly and write “50.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked another debtor, ‘How much do you owe?’ The man replied, ‘A hundred containers of wheat.’ The manager told him, ‘Get your bill and write “80.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The master praised the dishonest servant manager for being so clever, because worldly people are more clever than enlightened people in dealing with their own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m telling you, make friends for yourselves by means of unrighteous wealth, so that when it fails, they will welcome you into eternal homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is faithful with very little is also faithful with a lot, and whoever is dishonest with very little is also dishonest with a lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you haven’t been faithful with unrighteous wealth, who will trust you with true wealth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you haven’t been faithful with what belongs to foreigners, who will give you what is your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No servant can serve two masters, because either he will hate one and love the other, or be loyal to one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and wealth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Pharisees, who love money, had been listening to all this and began to ridicule Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them, “You try to justify yourselves in front of people, but God knows your hearts, because what is highly valued by people is detestable to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Law and the Prophets were fulfilled with John. Since then, the good news about the kingdom of God is being proclaimed, and everybody enters it enthusiastically.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, it is easier for heaven and earth to disappear than for one stroke of a letter in the Law to be dropped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any man who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery, and the man who marries a woman divorced from her husband commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Once there was a rich man who used to dress in purple and fine linen and live in great luxury every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A beggar named Lazarus, who was covered with sores, was brought to his gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was always trying to satisfy his hunger with what fell from the rich man’s table. Even the dogs used to come and lick his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “One day, the beggar died and was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s side. The rich man also died and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the afterlife, where he was in constant torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far away and Lazarus by his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he shouted, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me! Send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water to cool off my tongue, because I am suffering in this fire.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But Abraham said, ‘My child, remember that during your lifetime you received blessings, while Lazarus received hardships. But now he is being comforted here, while you suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides all this, a wide chasm has been fixed between us, so that those who want to cross from this side to you cannot do so, nor can they cross from your side to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The rich man said, ‘Then I beg you, father, send Lazarus to my father’s house—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I have five brothers—to warn them, so that they won’t end up in this place of torture, too.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abraham said, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets. They should listen to them!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the rich man replied, ‘No, father Abraham! But if someone from the dead went to them, they would repent.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then Abraham told him, ‘If your brothers do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be persuaded, even if someone were to rise from the dead.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told his disciples, “It is inevitable that temptations to sin will come, but how terrible it will be for the person through whom they come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he were thrown into the sea than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch yourselves! If your brother sins, rebuke him, and if he repents, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if he sins against you seven times in a day and comes back to you seven times and says, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the apostles told the Lord, “Give us more faith!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord replied, “If you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose a man among you has a servant plowing or watching sheep. Would he say to him when he comes in from the field, ‘Come at once and have something to eat’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of course not. Instead, he would say to him, ‘Get dinner ready for me, and put on your apron and wait on me until I eat and drink. Then you can eat and drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He doesn’t praise the servant for doing what was commanded, does he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s the way it is with you. When you have done everything you were ordered to do, say, ‘We are worthless servants. We have done only what we ought to have done.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, Jesus was traveling along the border between Samaria and Galilee on the way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was going into a village, ten lepers met him. They stood at a distance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shouted, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw them, he told them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” While they were going, they were made clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of them, when he saw that he had been healed, came back and praised God with a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet and thanked him. Now that man was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked, “Ten men were made clean, weren’t they? Where are the other nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Except for this foreigner, were any of them found to return and give praise to God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told the man, “Get up, and go home! Your faith has saved you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once Jesus was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come. He answered them, “The kingdom of God is not coming with a visible display.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People won’t be saying, ‘Look! Here it is!’ or ‘There it is!’ because now the kingdom of God is among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told the disciples, “The time will come during which you will long to see one of these days when the Son of Man is with you, but you won’t see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will say to you, ‘Look! There he is!’ or ‘Look! Here he is!’ But don’t go and chase after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because just as lightning flashes and shines from one end of the sky to the other, so will the Son of Man be in his time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first he must suffer a great deal and be rejected by those living today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Just as it was in Noah’s time, so it will be in the Son of Man’s time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People were eating, drinking, marrying, and being given in marriage right up to the day when Noah went into the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was in Lot’s time. People were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the very day when Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day when the Son of Man is revealed will be like that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The person who is on the housetop that day must not come down to get his belongings out of his house. The person in the field, too, must not turn back to what’s left behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever tries to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life will preserve it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, two will be seated on the same couch that night. The one will be taken, and the other will be left behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding grain together. The one will be taken, and the other will be left behind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they asked him, “Where, Lord, will this take place?”
He told them, “Wherever there’s a corpse, that’s where the vultures will gather.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told his disciples a parable about their need to pray all the time and never give up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “In a city there was a judge who didn’t fear God or respect people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that city there was also a widow who kept coming to him and saying, ‘Grant me justice against my adversary.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a while the judge refused. But later, he told himself, ‘I don’t fear God or respect people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow keeps bothering me, I will grant her justice. Otherwise, she will keep coming and wear me out.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord added, “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Won’t God grant his chosen people justice when they cry out to him day and night? Is he slow to help them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, he will give them justice quickly. But when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also told this parable to some people who trusted in themselves, thinking they were righteous, but who looked down on everyone else:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men went up to the Temple to pray. One was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood by himself and prayed, ‘O God, I thank you that I’m not like other people—thieves, dishonest people, adulterers, or even this tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice a week, and I give a tenth of my entire income.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the tax collector stood at a distance and would not even look up to heaven. Instead, he continued to beat his chest and said, ‘O God, be merciful to me, the sinner that I am!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, this man, rather than the other one, went down to his home justified, because everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the person who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some people were even bringing their infants to Jesus to have him touch them. But when the disciples saw this, they sternly told the people not to do that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, however, called for the children and said, “Let the little children come to me, and stop keeping them away, because the kingdom of God belongs to people like these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, whoever doesn’t receive the kingdom of God as a little child will never get into it at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then an official asked Jesus, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me good?” Jesus asked him. “Nobody is good except for one—God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Never commit adultery. Never murder. Never steal. Never give false testimony. Honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The official replied, “I have kept all of these since I was a young man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he told him, “You still need to do one thing. Sell everything you have and give the money to the destitute, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come back and follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the official heard this he became sad, because he was very rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Jesus saw how sad he was, he said, “How hard it is for rich people to get into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, it’s easier for a camel to squeeze through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to get into the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were listening to Jesus asked, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “The things that are impossible for people are possible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “See, we have left everything we have and followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “I tell all of you with certainty, there is no one who has left his home, wife, brothers, parents, or children because of the kingdom of God
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will not receive many times as much in this world, as well as eternal life in the age to come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the Twelve aside and told them, “Pay attention! We’re going up to Jerusalem. Everything written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be fulfilled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he’ll be handed over to the unbelievers, and will be mocked, insulted, and spit on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they have whipped him, they’ll kill him, but on the third day he’ll rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t understand any of this. What he said was hidden from them, and they didn’t know what he meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was approaching Jericho, there was a blind man sitting by the road begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard the crowd going by, he asked what was happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him that Jesus from Nazareth was coming by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he shouted, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people at the front of the crowd sternly told him to be quiet, but he started shouting even louder, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus stopped and ordered the man to be brought to him. When he came near, Jesus asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want me to do for you?”
He said, “Lord, I want to see again!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told him, “See again! Your faith has made you well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the man could see again and began to follow Jesus, glorifying God. All the people saw this and gave praise to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a man named Zacchaeus appeared. He was a leading tax collector, and a rich one at that!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was trying to see who Jesus was, but he couldn’t do so due to the crowd, since he was a short man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he ran ahead and climbed a sycamore tree to see Jesus, who was going to pass that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came to the tree, he looked up and said, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down! I must stay at your house today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacchaeus came down quickly and was glad to welcome him into his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the people who saw this began to complain: “Jesus is going to be the guest of a notorious sinner!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, Zacchaeus stood up and announced to the Lord, “Look! I’m giving half of my possessions to the destitute, and if I have accused anyone falsely, I’m repaying four times as much as I owe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told him, “Today salvation has come to this home, because this man is also a descendant of Abraham,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Son of Man has come to seek and to save the lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were listening to this, Jesus went on to tell a parable because he was near Jerusalem and because the people thought that the kingdom of God would appear immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “A prince went to a distant country to be appointed king and then to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called ten of his servants and gave them ten coins. He told them, ‘Invest this money until I come back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the citizens of his country hated him and sent a delegation to follow him and to announce, ‘We don’t want this man to rule over us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After he was appointed king, the prince came back. He ordered the servants to whom he had given the money to be called so he could find out what they had earned by investing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first servant came and said, ‘Sir, your coin has earned ten more coins.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king told him, ‘Well done, good servant! Because you have been trustworthy in a very small thing, take charge of ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The second servant came and said, ‘Your coin, sir, has earned five coins.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king told him, ‘You take charge of five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the other servant came and said, ‘Sir, look! Here’s your coin. I’ve kept it in a cloth for safekeeping
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I was afraid of you. You are a hard man. You withdraw what you didn’t deposit and harvest what you didn’t plant.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king told him, ‘I will judge you by your own words, you evil servant! You knew, did you, that I was a hard man, and that I withdraw what I didn’t deposit and harvest what I didn’t plant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then why didn’t you put my money in the bank? When I returned, I could have collected it with interest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So the king told those standing nearby, ‘Take the coin away from him and give it to the man who has the ten coins.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, ‘Sir, he already has ten coins!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I tell you, to everyone who has something, more will be given, but from the person who has nothing, even what he has will be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for these enemies of mine who didn’t want me to be their king—bring them here and slaughter them in my presence!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had said this, he traveled on and went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he approached Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples on ahead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go into the village ahead of you,” he said. “As you enter, you will find a colt tied up that no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it along.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you why you are untying it, say this: ‘The Lord needs it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who were sent went off and found it as Jesus had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples answered, “The Lord needs it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought the colt to Jesus and put their coats on it, and Jesus sat upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was riding along, people kept spreading their coats on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was now approaching the descent from the Mount of Olives. The whole crowd of disciples began to rejoice and to praise God with a loud voice because of all the miracles they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said,
“How blessed is the king
    who comes in the name of the Lord!
Peace in heaven,
    and glory in the highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd told Jesus, “Teacher, tell your disciples to be quiet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “I tell you, if they were quiet, the stones would cry out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came closer and saw the city, he began to grieve over it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you had only known today what could have brought you peace! But now it is hidden from your sight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the days will come when your enemies will build walls around you, surround you, and close you in on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will level you to the ground—you and those who live within your city limits. They will not leave one stone on another within your walls, because you didn’t recognize the time when you were visited.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went into the Temple and began to throw out those who were selling things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “It is written, ‘My house is to be called a house of prayer,’ but you have turned it into a hideout for bandits!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began teaching in the Temple every day. The high priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people kept looking for a way to kill him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they couldn’t find a way to do it, because all the people were eager to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, while Jesus was teaching the people in the Temple and telling them the good news, the high priests and the scribes came with the elders
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked him, “Tell us: By what authority are you doing these things, and who gave you this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I, too, will ask you a question. Tell me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was John’s authority to baptize from heaven or from humans?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They discussed this among themselves: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From humans,’ all the people will stone us to death, because they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they answered that they didn’t know where it was from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them, “Then I won’t tell you by what authority I’m doing these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to tenant farmers, and went abroad for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the right time he sent a servant to the farmers in order to get his share of the produce of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him and sent him back empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent another servant, and they beat him, too, treated him shamefully, and sent him back empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent a third, and they wounded him and threw him out, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What should I do? I’ll send my son whom I love. Maybe they’ll respect him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the farmers saw him, they talked it over among themselves and said, ‘This is the heir. Let’s kill him so that the inheritance will be ours!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. Now what will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will come and destroy those farmers and give the vineyard to others.”
Those who heard him said, “That must never happen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus looked at them and asked, “What does this text mean:
‘The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, and it will crush anyone on whom it falls.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the scribes and the high priests realized that Jesus had told this parable about them, they wanted to arrest him right then, but they were afraid of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they watched him closely and sent spies who pretended to be honest men in order to trap him in what he would say. They wanted to hand him over to the jurisdiction of the governor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so they asked him, “Teacher, we know that you’re right in what you say and teach, and that you don’t favor any individual, but teach the way of God truthfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he discerned their craftiness and responded to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Show me a denarius. Whose face and name does it have?”
“Caesar’s,” they replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them, “Then give back to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they couldn’t catch him before the people in what he said. Amazed at his answer, they became silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some Sadducees, who claim there is no resurrection, came to Jesus
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked him, “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no child, the man should marry the widow and have children for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married and died childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the second
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third married her. In the same way, all seven died and left no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, the woman died, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the resurrection, whose wife will the woman be, since the seven had married her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “Those who belong to this age marry and are married,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but those who are considered worthy of a place in that age and in the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor can they die anymore, because they are like the angels and, since they share in the resurrection, are God’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even Moses demonstrated in the story about the bush that the dead are raised, when he calls the Lord, ‘the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living, because he considers all people to be alive to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the scribes replied, “Teacher, you have given a fine answer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they no longer dared to ask him another question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them, “How can people say that the Messiah is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because David himself in the book of Psalms says,
‘The Lord told my Lord,
    “Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David calls him ‘Lord.’ Then how can he be his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While all the people were listening, he told his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware of the scribes! They like to walk around in long robes and love to be greeted in the marketplaces and to have the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They devour widows’ houses and say long prayers to cover it up. They will receive greater condemnation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus looked up and saw rich people dropping their gifts into the offering box.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he saw a destitute widow drop in two small copper coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I tell you with certainty, this destitute widow has dropped in more than all of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because all the others contributed to the offering out of their surplus, but she, in her poverty, dropped in everything she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while some people were talking about the Temple—how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts dedicated to God—he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for these things that you’re seeing, the time will come when not one stone will be left on another that won’t be completely demolished.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, “Teacher, when will these things happen, and what is to be the sign when these things are about to take place?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “See to it that you aren’t deceived, because many will come in my name, proclaiming, ‘I AM,’ and, ‘The time has come.’ Don’t follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you hear of wars and revolutions, don’t ever be terrified, because these sorts of things must take place first, but the end won’t come right away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went on to say to them, “Nation will rise up in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition there will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places, as well as terrifying events, including significant signs from heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But before all these things, people will arrest you and persecute you. They will hand you over to synagogues and prisons, and you will be brought before kings and governors for my name’s sake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order to give you an opportunity to testify.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So purpose in your hearts not to prepare your defense ahead of time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I will give you the ability to speak, along with wisdom, that none of your opponents will be able to resist or refute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends, and they will put some of you to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated continuously by everyone on account of my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet not a hair on your head will be lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person who endures to the end will be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then understand that its devastation is approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those in Judea must flee to the mountains, those inside the city must leave it, and those in the countryside must not go into it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because these are the days of vengeance when all that is written will be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How terrible it will be for those women who are pregnant or who are nursing babies in those days!—because there will be great distress in the land and wrath against this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword and be carried off as captives among all the nations, and Jerusalem will be trampled on by unbelievers until the times of the unbelievers are fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There will be signs in the sun, the moon, and the stars, and there will be distress on earth among the nations that are confused by the roaring of the sea and its waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will faint from fear and apprehension because of what’s to be coming to the inhabited world, because the powers of the heavens will be disrupted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people will see ‘the Son of Man coming in a cloud’ with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now when these things begin to take place, stand up and lift up your heads, because your deliverance is approaching.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them a parable: “Look at the fig tree and all the trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they produce leaves, you can see for yourselves and know that summer is already approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see these things taking place, you will know that the kingdom of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell all of you with certainty, this generation won’t disappear until all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words won’t ever disappear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Constantly be on your guard so that your hearts will not be loaded down with self-indulgence, drunkenness, and the worries of this life, or that day will take you by surprise
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: like a trap, because it will come on everyone who lives on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be alert at all times, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things that are going to take place and to take your stand in the presence of the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now during the day Jesus would teach in the Temple, but when evening came he would go out and spend the night on what is called the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people would get up early in the morning to listen to him in the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Festival of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, was near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the high priests and the scribes were looking for a way to put him to death, because they were afraid of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Satan went into Judas called Iscariot, who belonged to the circle of the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went off and discussed with the high priests and the Temple police how he could betray Jesus to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were delighted, and agreed to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas accepted their offer and began to look for a good opportunity to betray Jesus to them when no crowd was present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread came, on which the Passover lamb was to be sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and make preparations for us to eat the Passover meal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Just after you go into the city, a man carrying a jug of water will meet you. Follow him into the house he enters
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks you, “Where is the room where I can eat the Passover meal with my disciples?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will show you a large upstairs room that is furnished. Get things ready for us there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went and found everything just as Jesus had told them, and they prepared the Passover meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the hour came, Jesus took his place at the table, along with his apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover meal with you before I suffer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I tell all of you, I will never eat it again until it finds its fulfillment in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a cup, gave thanks, and said, “Take this and share it among yourselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I tell you, from now on I will never drink the product of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a loaf of bread, gave thanks, broke it in pieces, and handed it to them, saying, “This is my body, which is given for you. Keep on doing this in memory of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did the same with the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant sealed by my blood, which is being poured out for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet look! The hand of the man who is betraying me is with me on the table!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is going away, just as it has been determined, but how terrible it will be for that man by whom he is betrayed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began to discuss among themselves which one of them was going to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an argument sprang up among them as to which one of them was to be regarded as the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told them, “The kings of the unbelievers lord it over them, and those who exercise authority over them are called benefactors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not to do so. On the contrary, the greatest among you should become like the youngest, and the one who leads should become like the one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because who is greater, the one who sits at the table, or the one who serves? It is the one at the table, isn’t it? But I’m among you as one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are the ones who have always stood by me in my trials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I confer a kingdom on you, just as my Father has conferred a kingdom on me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom and sit down on thrones to govern the twelve tribes of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Simon, Simon, listen! Satan has asked permission to sift all of you like wheat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I have prayed for you that your own faith may not fail. When you have come back, you must strengthen your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter told him, “Lord, I am ready to go even to prison and to die with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow today until you deny three times that you know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus asked his disciples, “When I sent you out without a wallet, traveling bag, or sandals, you didn’t lack anything, did you?”
They replied, “Nothing at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “But now whoever has a wallet must take it along, and his traveling bag, too. And the one who has no sword must sell his coat and buy one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I tell you, what has been written about me must be fulfilled: ‘He was counted among the criminals.’ Indeed, what is written about me must be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they said, “Lord, look! Here are two swords.”
He answered them, “Enough of that!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he left and went to the Mount of Olives, as usual. The disciples went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived, he told them, “Keep on praying that you may not be tempted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he withdrew from them about a stone’s throw, knelt down, and began to pray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, if you are willing, take this cup away from me. Yet not my will but yours be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then an angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his anguish he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat became like large drops of blood falling on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he got up from prayer, he went to the disciples and found them asleep from sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and keep on praying that you may not be tempted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was still speaking, a crowd arrived. The man called Judas, one of the Twelve, was leading them, and he came close to Jesus to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus asked him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who were around Jesus saw what was about to take place, they asked, “Lord, should we attack with our swords?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them struck the high priest’s servant, cutting off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “No more of this!” So he touched the wounded man’s ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told the high priests, the Temple police, and the elders, who had come for him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs as if I were a bandit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I was with you day after day in the Temple, you didn’t lay a hand on me. But this is your hour, when darkness reigns!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they arrested him, led him away, and brought him to the high priest’s house. But Peter was following at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had taken their seats, Peter, too, sat down among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A servant girl saw him sitting by the fire, stared at him, and said, “This man was with him, too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, “I don’t know him, woman!” he responded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little later, a man looked at him and said, “You are one of them, too.”
But Peter said, “Mister, I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About an hour later, another man emphatically asserted, “This man was certainly with him, because he is a Galilean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Mister, I don’t know what you’re talking about!” Just then, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
