verses.text: Then the Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. And Peter remembered the word from the Lord, and how he had told him, “Before a rooster crows today, you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went outside and cried bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men who were holding Jesus in custody began to make fun of him while they beat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They blindfolded him and asked him over and over again, “Prophesy! Who is the one who hit you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they kept insulting him in many other ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as day came, the elders of the people, the high priests, and the scribes assembled and brought him before their Council.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said, “If you are the Messiah, tell us.”
But he told them, “If I tell you, you won’t believe me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I ask you a question, you won’t answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the mighty God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they all asked, “Are you, then, the Son of God?”
He answered them, “You said it—I AM.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do we need any more testimony?” they asked. “We have heard it ourselves from his own mouth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole crowd got up and took him to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to accuse him, “We found this man corrupting our nation, forbidding us to pay taxes to Caesar, and saying that he is the Messiah, a king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
He answered, “You say so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate told the high priests and crowds, “I do not find anything chargeable in this man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept insisting, “He is stirring up the people with what he teaches all over Judea, from where he started in Galilee to this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard this, he asked whether the man was a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he learned with certainty that Jesus came from Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him off to Herod, who was in Jerusalem at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod was very glad to see Jesus, because he had been wanting to see him for a long time on account of what he had heard about him. He was also hoping to see some sign done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he continued to question him for a long time, but Jesus gave him no answer at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the high priests and the scribes stood nearby and continued to accuse him vehemently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even Herod and his soldiers treated him with contempt and made fun of him. He put a magnificent robe on Jesus and sent him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day. Before this they had been enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate called the high priests, the other leaders, and the people together
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told them, “You brought this man to me as one who turns the people against the government. And here in your presence I have examined him and have found him ‘Not Guilty’ of the charges you make against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither does Herod, because he sent him back to us! Indeed, this man has done nothing to deserve death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will punish him and let him go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was obligated to release someone for them at the festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all shouted out together, “Away with this man! Release Barabbas for us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This man had been put in prison for murder and for a revolt that had taken place in the city.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Pilate wanted to let Jesus go, so he appealed to them again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they continued to shout, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he spoke to them a third time: “What has he done wrong? I have found nothing in him worthy of death. So I will punish him and let him go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept pressing him with loud shouts, demanding that Jesus be crucified, and their shouts began to prevail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate pronounced his sentence that their demand should be carried out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he released the man who had been put in prison for revolt and murder—the man whose release they continued to demand—but he let them have their way with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they led Jesus away, they grabbed Simon, a man from Cyrene, as he was coming in from the country, and they put the cross on him and made him carry it behind Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large crowd of people followed him, including some women who kept mourning and wailing for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turned to them and said, “Women of Jerusalem, stop crying for me. Instead, cry for yourselves and for your children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the time is surely coming when people will say, ‘How blessed are the women who couldn’t bear children and the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’, and to the hills, ‘Cover us up!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they do this when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two others, who were criminals, were also led away to be executed with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they reached the place called The Skull, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus kept saying, “Father, forgive them, because they don’t know what they’re doing.” Then they divided his clothes among them by throwing dice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the people stood looking on. The leaders were mocking him by saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself, if he is the Messiah of God, the chosen one!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers also made fun of Jesus by coming up and offering him sour wine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also an inscription over him written in Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “This is the King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now one of the criminals hanging there kept insulting him, “You are the Messiah, aren’t you? Save yourself…and us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other criminal rebuked him, “Aren’t you afraid of God, since you are suffering the same penalty?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have been condemned justly, because we are getting what we deserve for what we have done, but this man has done nothing wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went on to plead, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “I tell you with certainty, today you will be with me in Paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was already about noon, and the whole land became dark until three in the afternoon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the sun had stopped shining, and the curtain in the sanctuary was torn in two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus cried out with a loud voice and said, “Father, into your hands I entrust my spirit.” After he said this, he breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion saw what had taken place, he praised God and said, “This man certainly was righteous!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the crowds who had come together for this spectacle saw what had taken place, they beat their chests and left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all his acquaintances, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, were standing at a distance watching these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Council, a good and righteous man—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he had not voted for their plan and action—from the Jewish town of Arimathea; and he was waiting for the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took it down, wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid it in a tomb cut in the rock, in which no one had yet been laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was just beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the women who had come with Jesus from Galilee, following close behind, saw the tomb and how his body was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went back and prepared spices and perfumes, and on the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at early dawn on the first day of the week, they went to the tomb, taking the spices they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they went in, they didn’t find the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were puzzling over this, two men in dazzling robes suddenly stood beside them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the women remained terrified, bowing their faces to the ground, the men asked them, “Why are you looking among the dead for someone who is living?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, but has been raised. Remember what he told you while he was still in Galilee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The Son of Man must be handed over to sinful men, be crucified, and rise on the third day.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the women remembered Jesus’ words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They returned from the tomb and reported all these things to the eleven disciples and all the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women who told the apostles about it were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and some others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what they said seemed nonsense to them, so they did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. He stooped down and saw only the linen cloths. Then he went home, wondering about what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the same day, two of Jesus’ followers were walking to a village called Emmaus, about 60 stadia from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were talking with each other about all these things that had taken place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were discussing and analyzing what had happened, Jesus himself approached and began to walk with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but their eyes were prevented from recognizing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “What are you discussing with each other as you’re walking along?” They stood still and looked gloomy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one whose name was Cleopas answered him, “Are you the only visitor to Jerusalem who doesn’t know what happened there in the past few days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “What things?”
They answered him, “The events involving Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet, mighty in what he said and did before God and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how our high priests and leaders handed him over to be condemned to death and had him crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we kept hoping that he would be the one to redeem Israel. What is more, this is now the third day since these things occurred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even some of our women have startled us by what they told us. They were at the tomb early this morning
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and didn’t find his body there, so they came back and told us that they had seen a vision of angels, who were saying that he was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said. However, they didn’t see him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them, “O, how foolish you are! How slow you are to believe everything the prophets said!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Messiah had to suffer these things and then enter his glory, didn’t he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he explained to them all the passages of Scripture about himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they came near the village where the two men were headed, Jesus acted as though he were going farther.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they strongly urged him, “Stay with us, because it is almost evening and the daylight is nearly gone.” So he went in to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was at the table with them, he took the bread, blessed it, broke it in pieces, and gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then their eyes were opened, and they knew who he was. And he vanished from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked each other, “Our hearts kept burning within us as he was talking to us on the road and explaining the Scriptures to us, didn’t they?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They got up right away, went back to Jerusalem, and found the eleven disciples and their companions all together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept saying, “The Lord has really risen and has appeared to Simon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the two men began to tell what had happened on the road and how they had recognized him when he broke the bread in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were all talking about this, Jesus himself stood among them and told them, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were startled and terrified, thinking they were seeing a ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told them, “What’s frightening you? And why are you doubting?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at my hands and my feet, because it’s really me. Touch me and look at me, because a ghost doesn’t have flesh and bones as you see that I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though they were still skeptical due to their joy and astonishment, Jesus asked them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave him a piece of broiled fish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he took it and ate it in their presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “These are the words that I spoke to you while I was still with you—that everything written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets, and the Psalms had to be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he opened their minds so that they might understand the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “This is how it is written: the Messiah was to suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then repentance and forgiveness of sins is to be proclaimed in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am sending to you what my Father promised, so stay here in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, he led them out as far as Bethany, lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was blessing them, he left them and was taken up to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They worshipped him and returned to Jerusalem filled with great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were continually in the Temple, blessing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
